title: Rugby World Cup 2019 rankings - part four: Maggie Alphonsi's verdict on which quarter-finalists have the most effective back-row options
text:
Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions. The fourth installment sees Maggie Alphonsi deliver her verdict on which teams' back-row forwards have impressed most.

This is in order of importance to the teams' success, how the players in these positions can influence games during the knockout stages of the tournament.

8. Ireland

They’re too one-dimensional and I don’t get excited looking at their back row unit. CJ Stander carries well but doesn’t step or do much damage. Peter O’Mahony brings leadership but has been quiet while Josh van der Flier is a level below the very best. Injuries to the likes of Sean O’Brien, Dan Leavy, Jordi...
description: Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions.
